description.narrative: (Democratic Republic of the Congo): The Access, Reading, Retention and Accountability (ACCELERE!1) Activity improves equitable access to education and learning outcomes for girls and boys in 26 sub-educational provinces in the DRC. FY 2019 resources will improve reading and writing for at least 320,000 girls and boys across 1,600 private schools in four local languages (Kiswahili, Lingala, Ciluba, and Oral French), and support the training of 6,500 teachers and school directors during Year 5 of the project; provide access to primary schooling for 100,000 out-of-school children; increase student retention in targeted schools by 20 percent; and strengthen capacities of parent committees, school management committees, and school communities especially to support private and religious schools, private centres de rattrapage scolaire (CRSs), and centres d'apprentissage professionnel (CAPs). It will also support 200 non-formal alternative/ accelerated learning programs and vocational training for out-of-school youth. Specifically, ACCELERE!1 will provide in-kind grants to CSOs who then, in turn, will support vulnerable households to cover school fees through the Income Generating Activities (IGA) and ''Community Savings Plans" (AVEC) mechanisms. Additionally, ACCELERE! 1 collaborates, with national and provincial education authorities to develop teaching and learning materials and improve education governance and accountability. .ACCELERE!1 advances the USAID/DRC's DO 2 of improved lives through coordinated development approaches, while feeding into USAID's Education Strategy Goal 1, improved early grade reading. ACCELERE!1 also contributes to increasing education and skills to further economic growth and private sector, a U.S. foreign policy priority. ...... .
